articles.headline: Narendra Modi Could Make or Break Obama’s Climate Legacy
articles.snippet: Despite efforts by President Obama to win the Indian prime minister’s cooperation on reducing harmful emissions, India’s negotiators have so far staked out an uncompromising position.
articles.abstract: Despite efforts by President Obama to win the Indian prime minister’s cooperation on reducing harmful emissions, India’s negotiators have so far staked out an uncompromising position.
articles.lead_paragraph: LE BOURGET, France — Since Prime Minister Narendra Modi came to power, President Obama has not missed many opportunities to convey what a warm rapport he has forged with the Indian leader.
articles.byline: By Coral Davenport and Ellen Barry

articles.headline: Pfizer’s Long War on Taxation
articles.snippet: Pfizer, which plans to enjoy a lower tax rate in Ireland after a merger with Allergan, has long employed various tax avoidance strategies.
articles.abstract: Pfizer, which plans to enjoy a lower tax rate in Ireland after a merger with Allergan, has long employed various tax avoidance strategies.
articles.lead_paragraph: Long before Pfizer conceived of merging with Allergan in a $150 billion deal to rid itself of what its chief executive called an “an uncompetitive tax rate” in the United States, the company was deploying various tax avoidance strategies dating back to at least 1976.

articles.headline: ‘Love’ and Disbelief Follow Donald Trump Meeting With Black Leaders
articles.snippet: Mr. Trump’s political debut with black religious leaders was refashioned into a private meeting with a smaller group that downplayed talk of endorsements.
articles.abstract: Mr. Trump’s political debut with black religious leaders was refashioned into a private meeting with a smaller group that downplayed talk of endorsements.
articles.lead_paragraph: It seemed like a powerful counterpoint to the perception of Donald Trump as intolerant: A hundred black ministers and religious leaders would endorse him at his offices in Manhattan, vouching for his sensitivity and broad-mindedness.
articles.byline: By Michael Barbaro and John Corrales

articles.headline: How the Paris Attackers Honed Their Assault Through Trial and Error
articles.snippet: The Paris attacks revealed an enemy practicing what one official calls “dartboard terrorism,” hurling multiple lethal darts at a distant target until one hits the mark.
articles.abstract: The Paris attacks revealed an enemy practicing what one official calls “dartboard terrorism,” hurling multiple lethal darts at a distant target until one hits the mark.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — The gunfire had still not subsided, and those who could were running for their lives. But one man was crossing Paris to get close to the scenes of death.
articles.byline: By Rukmini Callimachi, Katrin Bennhold and Laure Fourquet
